content.text:
# Draft:The Warped Band

The Warped Band – The Official Tribute to Warped Tour is an American tribute band based in Central Pennsylvania. The group recreates the energy of the Vans Warped Tour by performing music from pop-punk, emo, ska, hardcore, and alternative rock artists such as Blink-182, Fall Out Boy, Good Charlotte, Green Day, Panic! At The Disco, Sum 41, and Paramore.
History
The Warped Band was formed to preserve the legacy and community spirit of the Vans Warped Tour (1995–2019). The band delivers high-energy performances designed to recreate the festival’s nostalgic atmosphere, with a focus on crowd interaction.
Band members Drew Zimmerman and Aaron Pearson have shared background insights in podcast interviews. In a 2024 episode of Emo Kids Anonymous, Drew Zimmerman discussed preparing for a Warped Tour–inspired event and the band’s fan-focused philosophy.
Musical style
The Warped Band covers a broad selection of genres featured on Warped Tour, including pop-punk, emo, ska, hardcore, and metalcore. Their live shows recreate the festival’s high-energy, participatory atmosphere.
Members
* Drew Zimmerman – guitar, vocals
* Aaron Pearson – guitar, vocals
* Justin Levendusky – bass
* Brandon Deamer – drums
* Austin Weaver – former drummer
Performances
In 2025, The Warped Band was selected to perform official pre-parties for the Vans Warped Tour 30th anniversary celebrations. They have played pre-party events in Washington, D.C. and Long Beach, California, and are scheduled to appear at the Orlando, Florida pre-party in November 2025.
The group also maintains an active U.S. touring schedule, with past and upcoming shows listed on their official Bandsintown profile.
Charitable activity
In October 2024, The Warped Band organized two shows in North Carolina (Wilmington and Raleigh), donating 100% of profits from exclusive show posters to the North Carolina Disaster Relief Fund in support of Hurricane Helene relief efforts.
The band is also affiliated with Food Fight Clothing, a company founded by guitarist Aaron Pearson. The brand continues the charitable tradition of the Warped Tour’s “skip the line” canned food donation program by donating 30% of all sales to Water Street Mission in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, supporting individuals facing homelessness and poverty.
Awards
In 2025, The Warped Band received the Best Tribute Act award at the Central Pennsylvania Music Awards (CPMA), presented by the Central Pennsylvania Music Hall of Fame.
